lyrics:
In and out of trouble, in and out of love
She had that dirty blonde hair, my vanilla cream-puff
She looked just like a million, maybe even two
I remember everything, how about you?
Ice cream kisses, summer in the park
Momma gettin' mad when we would sneak out in the dark

I'd take you to the movies just so I could hold your hand

You were a pretty lady, and I was your man

But I remember that one night like it was yesterday

We were standing in the moonlight, there was nothing in the way

You looked into my eyes, and said, "Show me love

Right here, right now, under the stars above"



We were 17, under the chestnut tree

I heard the thunder rolling as you sat down on me

And I was so in love, in love with you

I would have done anything for you



You had beautiful features, and a [?]

We'd been kissing at the game, hiding out under the bleachers

And the crowds don't hear it, you were going "Ohh"

Until Mr. Van showed up out the blue

Hot damn, we must have been running all night

When we got to your momma's house, you looked me in the eyes

And gave me a kiss, right before you said

That you're moving so far away

And I know it's over, yeah

You got tears rolling down your cheeks

You looking at me with those hazel eyes

That night under the chestnut tree



We were 17, under the chestnut tree

I heard the thunder rolling as you sat down on me

And I was so in love, in love with you

I would have done anything for you



We were 17, under the chestnut tree

I heard the thunder rolling as you sat down on me

And I was so in love, lo-lo-lo-love with you

I would have done anything for you
